serviceClients.primaryDisability:
Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) following a catastrophic accident.

Full-time wheelchair user – requires hoist and specialised equipment for all transfers.

Ongoing impacts:

Mobility loss and muscle weakness

Bladder and bowel incontinence (uridome, enemas, bowel care)

Risk of skin breakdown (daily monitoring and creams)

Emotional and behavioural dysregulation (occasional verbal/physical aggression)
serviceClients.supportNeeds:
24/7 Attendant Care – always 2:1 support (two support workers at all times, including overnight).

Transfers & Mobility: Hoist, tilt table, MOTOmed, ceiling hoist, power wheelchair – all require 2 workers.

Personal Care: Full assistance with bathing, toileting, dressing, grooming, and continence management.

Therapy Programs:

Hydrotherapy 3x per week with 2 workers + lifeguard.

Daily exercise: MOTOmed, tilt table, standing support, upper limb activities.

Daily Living:

Community access (movies, library, bowling, fishing, walks).

Household support (laundry, cleaning, equipment checks).

Overnight Care: Repositioning, uridome monitoring, and bed linen changes if needed.

Family Involvement: Parents (Sabah & Sue) are primary decision-makers, sister (Noor) is also highly involved. Parents require Arabic interpreter for formal meetings.

reminders.title: Equipment review meeting
reminders.description: Nadia (OT) and Sarah (Case Manager) will conduct a wheelchair check for Karm
